alert.note: Alert for Brookings; Moody (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Sioux Falls (Southeastern SD, Southwestern MN, and Northwestern IA)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 09 at 7:53AM MDT until April 12 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Sioux Falls
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Sioux Falls SD has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in South Dakota...Iowa... Big Sioux River below Dell Rapids affecting Minnehaha County. Big Sioux River at Sioux Falls I-90 affecting Minnehaha County. Big Sioux River near Brookings affecting Brookings and Moody Counties. Big Sioux River at Akron affecting Union and Plymouth Counties. ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in South Dakota... Iowa... Big Sioux River above Hawarden affecting Lincoln, Sioux and Union Counties. .Snow melt and increased reservoir releases will cause the river flows to become high. Expect minor flooding downstream from the dam. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON TO WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Big Sioux River near Brookings. * WHEN...From Monday afternoon to Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, significant amounts of pasture and farm lands begin flooding on the left bank of the river. The road south of the Brookings water treatment plant is flooded, as is 217th Street between 468th and 469th Avenues. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 5.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow afternoon to a crest of 9.3 feet early Tuesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Tuesday evening. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 am CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Big Sioux River Brookings 9.0 5.1 Sun 7 am 8.3 9.3 8.7 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Monday morning at 1100 AM CDT.
